51.verse: Your enemies joke about me, the one you anointed as their king.

52.verse: And yet—blessed be the Lord forever! Amen and amen!

1.verse: A prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, through all the generations you have been our home!

2.verse: Before the mountains were created, before the earth was formed, you are God without beginning or end.

3.verse: You speak, and man turns back to dust.

4.verse: A thousand years are but as yesterday to you! They are like a single hour!

5.verse: We glide along the tides of time as swiftly as a racing river and vanish as quickly as a dream. We are like grass that is green in the morning but mowed down and withered before the evening shadows fall.

6.verse: We glide along the tides of time as swiftly as a racing river and vanish as quickly as a dream. We are like grass that is green in the morning but mowed down and withered before the evening shadows fall.

7.verse: We die beneath your anger; we are overwhelmed by your wrath.

8.verse: You spread out our sins before you—our secret sins—and see them all.

9.verse: No wonder the years are long and heavy here beneath your wrath. All our days are filled with sighing.

10.verse: Seventy years are given us! And some may even live to eighty. But even the best of these years are often empty and filled with pain; soon they disappear, and we are gone.

11.verse: Who can realize the terrors of your anger? Which of us can fear you as he should?

12.verse: Teach us to number our days and recognize how few they are; help us to spend them as we should.

13.verse: O Jehovah, come and bless us! How long will you delay? Turn away your anger from us.

14.verse: Satisfy us in our earliest youth with your loving-kindness, giving us constant joy to the end of our lives.

15.verse: Give us gladness in proportion to our former misery! Replace the evil years with good.

16.verse: Let us see your miracles again; let our children see glorious things, the kind you used to do,

17.verse: and let the Lord our God favor us and give us success. May he give permanence to all we do.

1.verse: We live within the shadow of the Almighty, sheltered by the God who is above all gods.

2.verse: This I declare, that he alone is my refuge, my place of safety; he is my God, and I am trusting him.

3.verse: For he rescues you from every trap and protects you from the fatal plague.

4.verse: He will shield you with his wings! They will shelter you. His faithful promises are your armor.

5.verse: Now you don’t need to be afraid of the dark anymore, nor fear the dangers of the day;

6.verse: nor dread the plagues of darkness, nor disasters in the morning.

7.verse: Though a thousand fall at my side, though ten thousand are dying around me, the evil will not touch me.

8.verse: I will see how the wicked are punished, but I will not share it.

9.verse: For Jehovah is my refuge! I choose the God above all gods to shelter me.

10.verse: How then can evil overtake me or any plague come near?

11.verse: For he orders his angels to protect you wherever you go.

12.verse: They will steady you with their hands to keep you from stumbling against the rocks on the trail.

13.verse: You can safely meet a lion or step on poisonous snakes, yes, even trample them beneath your feet!

14.verse: For the Lord says, “Because he loves me, I will rescue him; I will make him great because he trusts in my name.

15.verse: When he calls on me, I will answer; I will be with him in trouble and rescue him and honor him.

16.verse: I will satisfy him with a full life and give him my salvation.”

1.verse: A song to sing on the Lord’s Day. It is good to say thank you to the Lord, to sing praises to the God who is above all gods.

2.verse: Every morning tell him, “Thank you for your kindness,” and every evening rejoice in all his faithfulness.

3.verse: Sing his praises, accompanied by music from the harp and lute and lyre.

4.verse: You have done so much for me, O Lord. No wonder I am glad! I sing for joy.

5.verse: O Lord, what miracles you do! And how deep are your thoughts!

6.verse: Unthinking people do not understand them! No fool can comprehend this:

7.verse: that although the wicked flourish like weeds, there is only eternal destruction ahead of them.

8.verse: But the Lord continues forever, exalted in the heavens,

9.verse: while his enemies—all evildoers—shall be scattered.

10.verse: But you have made me as strong as a wild bull. How refreshed I am by your blessings!

11.verse: I have heard the doom of my enemies announced and seen them destroyed.

12.verse: But the godly shall flourish like palm trees and grow tall as the cedars of Lebanon.

13.verse: For they are transplanted into the Lord’s own garden and are under his personal care.

14.verse: Even in old age they will still produce fruit and be vital and green.

15.verse: This honors the Lord and exhibits his faithful care. He is my shelter. There is nothing but goodness in him!

1.verse: Jehovah is King! He is robed in majesty and strength. The world is his throne.

2.verse: O Lord, you have reigned from prehistoric times, from the everlasting past.

3.verse: The mighty oceans thunder your praise.

4.verse: You are mightier than all the breakers pounding on the seashores of the world!

5.verse: Your royal decrees cannot be changed. Holiness is forever the keynote of your reign.

1.verse: Lord God, to whom vengeance belongs, let your glory shine out. Arise and judge the earth; sentence the proud to the penalties they deserve.

2.verse: Lord God, to whom vengeance belongs, let your glory shine out. Arise and judge the earth; sentence the proud to the penalties they deserve.

3.verse: Lord, how long shall the wicked be allowed to triumph and exult?

4.verse: Hear their insolence! See their arrogance! How these men of evil boast!

5.verse: See them oppressing your people, O Lord, afflicting those you love.

6.verse: They murder widows, immigrants, and orphans, for “The Lord isn’t looking,” they say, “and besides, he doesn’t care.”

7.verse: They murder widows, immigrants, and orphans, for “The Lord isn’t looking,” they say, “and besides, he doesn’t care.”

8.verse: Fools!

9.verse: Is God deaf and blind—he who makes ears and eyes?

10.verse: He punishes the nations—won’t he also punish you? He knows everything—doesn’t he also know what you are doing?

11.verse: The Lord is fully aware of how limited and futile the thoughts of mankind are,

12.verse: so he helps us by punishing us. This makes us follow his paths and gives us respite from our enemies while God traps them and destroys them.

13.verse: so he helps us by punishing us. This makes us follow his paths and gives us respite from our enemies while God traps them and destroys them.

14.verse: The Lord will not forsake his people, for they are his prize.

15.verse: Judgment will again be just, and all the upright will rejoice.

16.verse: Who will protect me from the wicked? Who will be my shield?

17.verse: I would have died unless the Lord had helped me.

18.verse: I screamed, “I’m slipping, Lord!” and he was kind and saved me.

19.verse: Lord, when doubts fill my mind, when my heart is in turmoil, quiet me and give me renewed hope and cheer.

20.verse: Will you permit a corrupt government to rule under your protection—a government permitting wrong to defeat right?

21.verse: Do you approve of those who condemn the innocent to death? No! The Lord my God is my fortress—the mighty Rock where I can hide.

22.verse: Do you approve of those who condemn the innocent to death? No! The Lord my God is my fortress—the mighty Rock where I can hide.

23.verse: God has made the sins of evil men to boomerang upon them! He will destroy them by their own plans. Jehovah our God will cut them off.

1.verse: Oh, come, let us sing to the Lord! Give a joyous shout in honor of the Rock of our salvation!

2.verse: Come before him with thankful hearts. Let us sing him psalms of praise.

3.verse: For the Lord is a great God, the great King of all gods.

4.verse: He controls the formation of the depths of the earth and the mightiest mountains; all are his.

5.verse: He made the sea and formed the land; they too are his.

6.verse: Come, kneel before the Lord our Maker,

7.verse: for he is our God. We are his sheep, and he is our Shepherd. Oh, that you would hear him calling you today and come to him!

8.verse: Don’t harden your hearts as Israel did in the wilderness at Meribah and Massah.

9.verse: For there your fathers doubted me, though they had seen so many of my miracles before. My patience was severely tried by their complaints.

10.verse: “For forty years I watched them in disgust,” the Lord God says. “They were a nation whose thoughts and heart were far away from me. They refused to accept my laws.

11.verse: Therefore, in mighty wrath I swore that they would never enter the Promised Land, the place of rest I planned for them.”

1.verse: Sing a new song to the Lord! Sing it everywhere around the world!

2.verse: Sing out his praises! Bless his name. Each day tell someone that he saves.

3.verse: Publish his glorious acts throughout the earth. Tell everyone about the amazing things he does.

4.verse: For the Lord is great beyond description and greatly to be praised. Worship only him among the gods!

5.verse: For the gods of other nations are merely idols, but our God made the heavens!

6.verse: Honor and majesty surround him; strength and beauty are in his Temple.

7.verse: O nations of the world, confess that God alone is glorious and strong.

8.verse: Give him the glory he deserves! Bring your offering and come to worship him.

9.verse: Worship the Lord with the beauty of holy lives. Let the earth tremble before him.

10.verse: Tell the nations that Jehovah reigns! He rules the world. His power can never be overthrown. He will judge all nations fairly.

11.verse: Let the heavens be glad, the earth rejoice; let the vastness of the roaring seas demonstrate his glory.

12.verse: Praise him for the growing fields, for they display his greatness. Let the trees of the forest rustle with praise.

13.verse: For the Lord is coming to judge the earth; he will judge the nations fairly and with truth!

1.verse: Jehovah is King! Let all the earth rejoice! Tell the farthest islands to be glad.

2.verse: Clouds and darkness surround him. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of his throne.

3.verse: Fire goes forth before him and burns up all his foes.

4.verse: His lightning flashes out across the world. The earth sees and trembles.

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax before the Lord of all the earth.

6.verse: The heavens declare his perfect righteousness; every nation sees his glory.

7.verse: Let those who worship idols be disgraced—all who brag about their worthless gods—for every god must bow to him!

8.verse: Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah have heard of your justice, Lord, and are glad that you reign in majesty over the entire earth and are far greater than these other gods.

9.verse: Jerusalem and all the cities of Judah have heard of your justice, Lord, and are glad that you reign in majesty over the entire earth and are far greater than these other gods.

10.verse: The Lord loves those who hate evil; he protects the lives of his people and rescues them from the wicked.

11.verse: Light is sown for the godly and joy for the good.

12.verse: May all who are godly be happy in the Lord and crown him, our holy God.

1.verse: Sing a new song to the Lord telling about his mighty deeds! For he has won a mighty victory by his power and holiness.

2.verse: He has announced this victory and revealed it to every nation by fulfilling his promise to be kind to Israel. The whole earth has seen God’s salvation of his people.

3.verse: He has announced this victory and revealed it to every nation by fulfilling his promise to be kind to Israel. The whole earth has seen God’s salvation of his people.

4.verse: That is why the earth breaks out in praise to God and sings for utter joy!

5.verse: Sing your praise accompanied by music from the harp.

6.verse: Let the cornets and trumpets shout! Make a joyful symphony before the Lord, the King!

7.verse: Let the sea in all its vastness roar with praise! Let the earth and all those living on it shout, “Glory to the Lord.”

8.verse: Let the waves clap their hands in glee and the hills sing out their songs of joy before the Lord, for he is coming to judge the world with perfect justice.

9.verse: Let the waves clap their hands in glee and the hills sing out their songs of joy before the Lord, for he is coming to judge the world with perfect justice.

1.verse: Jehovah is King! Let the nations tremble! He is enthroned between the Guardian Angels. Let the whole earth shake.

2.verse: Jehovah sits in majesty in Zion, supreme above all rulers of the earth.

3.verse: Let them reverence your great and holy name.

4.verse: This mighty King is determined to give justice. Fairness is the touchstone of everything he does. He gives justice throughout Israel.

5.verse: Exalt the Lord our holy God! Bow low before his feet.

6.verse: When Moses and Aaron and Samuel, his prophet, cried to him for help, he answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud, and they followed his instructions.

8.verse: O Jehovah our God! You answered them and forgave their sins, yet punished them when they went wrong.

9.verse: Exalt the Lord our God and worship at his holy mountain in Jerusalem, for he is holy.

1.verse: Shout with joy before the Lord, O earth!

2.verse: Obey him gladly; come before him, singing with joy.

3.verse: Try to realize what this means—the Lord is God! He made us—we are his people, the sheep of his pasture.

4.verse: Go through his open gates with great thanksgiving; enter his courts with praise. Give thanks to him and bless his name.

5.verse: For the Lord is always good. He is always loving and kind, and his faithfulness goes on and on to each succeeding generation.

1.verse: I will sing about your loving-kindness and your justice, Lord. I will sing your praises!

2.verse: I will try to walk a blameless path, but how I need your help, especially in my own home, where I long to act as I should.

3.verse: Help me to refuse the low and vulgar things; help me to abhor all crooked deals of every kind, to have no part in them.

4.verse: I will reject all selfishness and stay away from every evil.

5.verse: I will not tolerate anyone who secretly slanders his neighbors; I will not permit conceit and pride.

6.verse: I will make the godly of the land my heroes and invite them to my home. Only those who are truly good shall be my servants.

7.verse: But I will not allow those who deceive and lie to stay in my house.

8.verse: My daily task will be to ferret out criminals and free the city of God from their grip.

1.verse: A prayer when overwhelmed with trouble. Lord, hear my prayer! Listen to my plea!

2.verse: Don’t turn away from me in this time of my distress. Bend down your ear and give me speedy answers,

3.verse: for my days disappear like smoke. My health is broken, and my heart is sick; it is trampled like grass and is withered. My food is tasteless, and I have lost my appetite.

4.verse: for my days disappear like smoke. My health is broken, and my heart is sick; it is trampled like grass and is withered. My food is tasteless, and I have lost my appetite.

5.verse: I am reduced to skin and bones because of all my groaning and despair.

6.verse: I am like a vulture in a far-off wilderness or like an owl alone in the desert.

7.verse: I lie awake, lonely as a solitary sparrow on the roof.

8.verse: My enemies taunt me day after day and curse at me.

9.verse: I eat ashes instead of bread. My tears run down into my drink because of your anger against me, because of your wrath. For you have rejected me and thrown me out.

10.verse: I eat ashes instead of bread. My tears run down into my drink because of your anger against me, because of your wrath. For you have rejected me and thrown me out.

11.verse: My life is passing swiftly as the evening shadows. I am withering like grass,

12.verse: while you, Lord, are a famous King forever. Your fame will endure to every generation.

13.verse: I know that you will come and have mercy on Jerusalem—and now is the time to pity her—the time you promised help.

14.verse: For your people love every stone in her walls and feel sympathy for every grain of dust in her streets.

15.verse: Now let the nations and their rulers tremble before the Lord, before his glory.

16.verse: For Jehovah will rebuild Jerusalem! He will appear in his glory!

17.verse: He will listen to the prayers of the destitute, for he is never too busy to heed their requests.

18.verse: I am recording this so that future generations will also praise the Lord for all that he has done. And a people that shall be created shall praise the Lord.

19.verse: Tell them that God looked down from his temple in heaven

20.verse: and heard the groans of his people in slavery—they were children of death—and released them,

21.verse: so that multitudes would stream to the Temple in Jerusalem to praise him, and his praises were sung throughout the city; and many rulers throughout the earth came to worship him.

22.verse: so that multitudes would stream to the Temple in Jerusalem to praise him, and his praises were sung throughout the city; and many rulers throughout the earth came to worship him.

23.verse: He has cut me down in middle life, shortening my days.

24.verse: But I cried to him, “O God, you live forever and forever! Don’t let me die halfway through my years!

25.verse: In ages past you laid the foundations of the earth and made the heavens with your hands!

26.verse: They shall perish, but you go on forever. They will grow old like worn-out clothing, and you will change them like a man putting on a new shirt and throwing away the old one!

27.verse: But you yourself never grow old. You are forever, and your years never end.

28.verse: “But our families will continue; generation after generation will be preserved by your protection.”

1.verse: I bless the holy name of God with all my heart.

2.verse: Yes, I will bless the Lord and not forget the glorious things he does for me.

3.verse: He forgives all my sins. He heals me.

4.verse: He ransoms me from hell. He surrounds me with loving-kindness and tender mercies.

5.verse: He fills my life with good things! My youth is renewed like the eagle’s!

6.verse: He gives justice to all who are treated unfairly.

7.verse: He revealed his will and nature to Moses and the people of Israel.

8.verse: He is merciful and tender toward those who don’t deserve it; he is slow to get angry and full of kindness and love.

9.verse: He never bears a grudge, nor remains angry forever.

10.verse: He has not punished us as we deserve for all our sins,

11.verse: for his mercy toward those who fear and honor him is as great as the height of the heavens above the earth.

12.verse: He has removed our sins as far away from us as the east is from the west.

13.verse: He is like a father to us, tender and sympathetic to those who reverence him.

14.verse: For he knows we are but dust

15.verse: and that our days are few and brief, like grass, like flowers,

16.verse: blown by the wind and gone forever.

17.verse: But the loving-kindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting to those who reverence him; his salvation is to children’s children of those who are faithful to his covenant and remember to obey him!

18.verse: But the loving-kindness of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting to those who reverence him; his salvation is to children’s children of those who are faithful to his covenant and remember to obey him!

19.verse: The Lord has made the heavens his throne; from there he rules over everything there is.

20.verse: Bless the Lord, you mighty angels of his who carry out his orders, listening for each of his commands.

21.verse: Yes, bless the Lord, you armies of his angels who serve him constantly.

22.verse: Let everything everywhere bless the Lord. And how I bless him too!

1.verse: I bless the Lord: O Lord my God, how great you are! You are robed with honor and with majesty and light! You stretched out the starry curtain of the heavens,

2.verse: I bless the Lord: O Lord my God, how great you are! You are robed with honor and with majesty and light! You stretched out the starry curtain of the heavens,

3.verse: and hollowed out the surface of the earth to form the seas. The clouds are his chariots. He rides upon the wings of the wind.

4.verse: The angels are his messengers—his servants of fire!

5.verse: You bound the world together so that it would never fall apart.

6.verse: You clothed the earth with floods of waters covering up the mountains.

7.verse: You spoke, and at the sound of your shout the water collected into its vast ocean beds, and mountains rose and valleys sank to the levels you decreed.

8.verse: You spoke, and at the sound of your shout the water collected into its vast ocean beds, and mountains rose and valleys sank to the levels you decreed.

9.verse: And then you set a boundary for the seas so that they would never again cover the earth.

10.verse: He placed springs in the valleys and streams that gush from the mountains.

11.verse: They give water for all the animals to drink. There the wild donkeys quench their thirst,

12.verse: and the birds nest beside the streams and sing among the branches of the trees.

13.verse: He sends rain upon the mountains and fills the earth with fruit.

14.verse: The tender grass grows up at his command to feed the cattle, and there are fruit trees, vegetables, and grain for man to cultivate,

15.verse: and wine to make him glad, and olive oil as lotion for his skin, and bread to give him strength.

16.verse: The Lord planted the cedars of Lebanon. They are tall and flourishing.

17.verse: There the birds make their nests, the storks in the firs.

18.verse: High in the mountains are pastures for the wild goats, and rock badgers burrow in among the rocks and find protection there.

19.verse: He assigned the moon to mark the months and the sun to mark the days.

20.verse: He sends the night and darkness, when all the forest folk come out.

21.verse: Then the young lions roar for their food, but they are dependent on the Lord.

22.verse: At dawn they slink back into their dens to rest,

23.verse: and men go off to work until the evening shadows fall again.

24.verse: O Lord, what a variety you have made! And in wisdom you have made them all! The earth is full of your riches.

25.verse: There before me lies the mighty ocean, teeming with life of every kind, both great and small.

26.verse: And look! See the ships! And over there, the whale you made to play in the sea.

27.verse: Every one of these depends on you to give them daily food.

28.verse: You supply it, and they gather it. You open wide your hand to feed them, and they are satisfied with all your bountiful provision.

29.verse: But if you turn away from them, then all is lost. And when you gather up their breath, they die and turn again to dust.

30.verse: Then you send your Spirit, and new life is born to replenish all the living of the earth.

31.verse: Praise God forever! How he must rejoice in all his work!

32.verse: The earth trembles at his glance; the mountains burst into flame at his touch.

33.verse: I will sing to the Lord as long as I live. I will praise God to my last breath!

34.verse: May he be pleased by all these thoughts about him, for he is the source of all my joy.

35.verse: Let all sinners perish—all who refuse to praise him. But I will praise him. Hallelujah!

1.verse: Thank the Lord for all the glorious things he does; proclaim them to the nations.

2.verse: Sing his praises and tell everyone about his miracles.

3.verse: Glory in the Lord; O worshipers of God, rejoice.

4.verse: Search for him and for his strength, and keep on searching!

5.verse: Think of the mighty deeds he did for us, his chosen ones—descendants of God’s servant Abraham, and of Jacob. Remember how he destroyed our enemies.

6.verse: Think of the mighty deeds he did for us, his chosen ones—descendants of God’s servant Abraham, and of Jacob. Remember how he destroyed our enemies.

7.verse: He is the Lord our God. His goodness is seen everywhere throughout the land.

8.verse: Though a thousand generations pass he never forgets his promise, his covenant with Abraham and Isaac

9.verse: Though a thousand generations pass he never forgets his promise, his covenant with Abraham and Isaac

10.verse: and confirmed with Jacob. This is his never-ending treaty with the people of Israel: “I will give you the land of Canaan as your inheritance.”

11.verse: and confirmed with Jacob. This is his never-ending treaty with the people of Israel: “I will give you the land of Canaan as your inheritance.”

12.verse: He said this when they were but few in number, very few, and were only visitors in Canaan.

13.verse: Later they were dispersed among the nations and were driven from one kingdom to another;

14.verse: but through it all he would not let one thing be done to them apart from his decision. He destroyed many a king who tried!

15.verse: “Touch not these chosen ones of mine,” he warned, “and do not hurt my prophets.”

16.verse: He called for a famine on the land of Canaan, cutting off its food supply.

17.verse: Then he sent Joseph as a slave to Egypt to save his people from starvation.

18.verse: There in prison they hurt his feet with fetters and placed his neck in an iron collar

19.verse: until God’s time finally came—how God tested his patience!

20.verse: Then the king sent for him and set him free.

21.verse: He was put in charge of all the king’s possessions.

22.verse: At his pleasure he could imprison the king’s aides and teach the king’s advisors.

23.verse: Then Jacob (Israel) arrived in Egypt and lived there with his sons.

24.verse: In the years that followed, the people of Israel multiplied explosively until they were a greater nation than their rulers.

25.verse: At that point God turned the Egyptians against the Israelis; they hated and enslaved them.

26.verse: But God sent Moses as his representative, and Aaron with him,

27.verse: to call down miracles of terror upon the land of Egypt.

28.verse: They followed his instructions. He sent thick darkness through the land

29.verse: and turned the nation’s water into blood, poisoning the fish.

30.verse: Then frogs invaded in enormous numbers; they were found even in the king’s private rooms.

31.verse: When Moses spoke, the flies and other insects swarmed in vast clouds from one end of Egypt to the other.

32.verse: Instead of rain he sent down murderous hail, and lightning flashes overwhelmed the nation.

33.verse: Their grapevines and fig trees were ruined; all the trees lay broken on the ground.

34.verse: He spoke, and hordes of locusts came

35.verse: and ate up everything green, destroying all the crops.

36.verse: Then he killed the oldest child in each Egyptian home, their pride and joy—

37.verse: and brought his people safely out from Egypt, loaded with silver and gold; there were no sick and feeble folk among them then.

38.verse: Egypt was glad when they were gone, for the dread of them was great.

39.verse: He spread out a cloud above them to shield them from the burning sun and gave them a pillar of flame at night to give them light.

40.verse: They asked for meat, and he sent them quail and gave them manna—bread from heaven.

41.verse: He opened up a rock, and water gushed out to form a river through the dry and barren land;

42.verse: for he remembered his sacred promises to Abraham his servant.

43.verse: So he brought his chosen ones singing into the Promised Land.

44.verse: He gave them the lands of the Gentiles, complete with their growing crops; they ate what others planted.

45.verse: This was done to make them faithful and obedient to his laws. Hallelujah!

1.verse: Hallelujah! Thank you, Lord! How good you are! Your love for us continues on forever.

2.verse: Who can ever list the glorious miracles of God? Who can ever praise him half enough?

3.verse: Happiness comes to those who are fair to others and are always just and good.

4.verse: Remember me too, O Lord, while you are blessing and saving your people.

5.verse: Let me share in your chosen ones’ prosperity and rejoice in all their joys, and receive the glory you give to them.

6.verse: Both we and our fathers have sinned so much.

7.verse: They weren’t impressed by the wonder of your miracles in Egypt and soon forgot your many acts of kindness to them. Instead they rebelled against you at the Red Sea.

8.verse: Even so you saved them—to defend the honor of your name and demonstrate your power to all the world.

9.verse: You commanded the Red Sea to divide, forming a dry road across its bottom. Yes, as dry as any desert!

10.verse: Thus you rescued them from their enemies.

11.verse: Then the water returned and covered the road and drowned their foes; not one survived.

12.verse: Then at last his people believed him. Then they finally sang his praise.

13.verse: Yet how quickly they forgot again! They wouldn’t wait for him to act

14.verse: but demanded better food, testing God’s patience to the breaking point.

15.verse: So he gave them their demands but sent them leanness in their souls.

16.verse: They were envious of Moses, yes, and Aaron too, the man anointed by God as his priest.

17.verse: Because of this, the earth opened and swallowed Dathan, Abiram, and his friends;

18.verse: and fire fell from heaven to consume these wicked men.

19.verse: For they preferred a statue of an ox that eats grass to the glorious presence of God himself.

20.verse: For they preferred a statue of an ox that eats grass to the glorious presence of God himself.

21.verse: Thus they despised their Savior who had done such mighty miracles in Egypt and at the Red Sea.

22.verse: Thus they despised their Savior who had done such mighty miracles in Egypt and at the Red Sea.

23.verse: So the Lord declared he would destroy them. But Moses, his chosen one, stepped into the breach between the people and their God and begged him to turn from his wrath and not destroy them.

24.verse: They refused to enter the Promised Land, for they wouldn’t believe his solemn oath to care for them.

25.verse: Instead, they pouted in their tents and mourned and despised his command.

26.verse: Therefore he swore that he would kill them in the wilderness

27.verse: and send their children away to distant lands as exiles.

28.verse: Then our fathers joined the worshipers of Baal at Peor and even offered sacrifices to the dead!

29.verse: With all these things they angered him—and so a plague broke out upon them

30.verse: and continued until Phinehas executed those whose sins had caused the plague to start.

31.verse: (For this good deed Phinehas will be remembered forever.)

32.verse: At Meribah, too, Israel angered God, causing Moses serious trouble,

33.verse: for he became angry and spoke foolishly.

34.verse: Nor did Israel destroy the nations in the land as God had told them to,

35.verse: but mingled in among the heathen and learned their evil ways,

36.verse: sacrificing to their idols, and were led away from God.

37.verse: They even sacrificed their little children to the demons—the idols of Canaan—shedding innocent blood and polluting the land with murder.

38.verse: They even sacrificed their little children to the demons—the idols of Canaan—shedding innocent blood and polluting the land with murder.

39.verse: Their evil deeds defiled them, for their love of idols was adultery in the sight of God.

40.verse: That is why Jehovah’s anger burned against his people, and he abhorred them.

41.verse: That is why he let the heathen nations crush them. They were ruled by those who hated them and oppressed by their enemies.

42.verse: That is why he let the heathen nations crush them. They were ruled by those who hated them and oppressed by their enemies.

43.verse: Again and again he delivered them from their slavery, but they continued to rebel against him and were finally destroyed by their sin.

44.verse: Yet, even so, he listened to their cries and heeded their distress;

45.verse: he remembered his promises to them and relented because of his great love,

46.verse: and caused even their enemies who captured them to pity them.

47.verse: O Lord God, save us! Regather us from the nations so we can thank your holy name and rejoice and praise you.

48.verse: Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Hallelujah!

1.verse: Say thank you to the Lord for being so good, for always being so loving and kind.

2.verse: Has the Lord redeemed you? Then speak out! Tell others he has saved you from your enemies.

3.verse: He brought the exiles back from the farthest corners of the earth.

4.verse: They were wandering homeless in the desert,

5.verse: hungry and thirsty and faint.

6.verse: “Lord, help!” they cried, and he did!

7.verse: He led them straight to safety and a place to live.

8.verse: Oh, that these men would praise the Lord for his loving-kindness, and for all of his wonderful deeds!

9.verse: For he satisfies the thirsty soul and fills the hungry soul with good.

10.verse: Who are these who sit in darkness, in the shadow of death, crushed by misery and slavery?

11.verse: They rebelled against the Lord, scorning him who is the God above all gods.

12.verse: That is why he broke them with hard labor; they fell and none could help them rise again.

13.verse: Then they cried to the Lord in their troubles, and he rescued them!

14.verse: He led them from the darkness and shadow of death and snapped their chains.

15.verse: Oh, that these men would praise the Lord for his loving-kindness and for all of his wonderful deeds!

16.verse: For he broke down their prison gates of brass and cut apart their iron bars.

17.verse: Others, the fools, were ill because of their sinful ways.

18.verse: Their appetites were gone, and death was near.

19.verse: Then they cried to the Lord in their troubles, and he helped them and delivered them.

20.verse: He spoke, and they were healed—snatched from the door of death.

21.verse: Oh, that these men would praise the Lord for his loving-kindness and for all of his wonderful deeds!

22.verse: Let them tell him thank you as their sacrifice and sing about his glorious deeds.

23.verse: And then there are the sailors sailing the seven seas, plying the trade routes of the world.

24.verse: They, too, observe the power of God in action.

25.verse: He calls to the storm winds; the waves rise high.

26.verse: Their ships are tossed to the heavens and sink again to the depths; the sailors cringe in terror.

27.verse: They reel and stagger like drunkards and are at their wit’s end.

28.verse: Then they cry to the Lord in their trouble, and he saves them.

29.verse: He calms the storm and stills the waves.

30.verse: What a blessing is that stillness as he brings them safely into harbor!

31.verse: Oh, that these men would praise the Lord for his loving-kindness and for all of his wonderful deeds!

32.verse: Let them praise him publicly before the congregation and before the leaders of the nation.

34.verse: and turns the good land of the wicked into deserts of salt.

35.verse: Again, he turns deserts into fertile, watered valleys.

36.verse: He brings the hungry to settle there and build their cities,

37.verse: to sow their fields and plant their vineyards, and reap their bumper crops!

38.verse: How he blesses them! They raise big families there and many cattle.

39.verse: But others become poor through oppression, trouble, and sorrow.

40.verse: For God pours contempt upon the haughty and causes princes to wander among ruins;

41.verse: but he rescues the poor who are godly and gives them many children and much prosperity.

42.verse: Good men everywhere will see it and be glad, while evil men are stricken silent.

43.verse: Listen, if you are wise, to what I am saying. Think about the loving-kindness of the Lord!

1.verse: O God, my heart is ready to praise you! I will sing and rejoice before you.

2.verse: Wake up, O harp and lyre! We will meet the dawn with song.

3.verse: I will praise you everywhere around the world, in every nation.

4.verse: For your loving-kindness is great beyond measure, high as the heavens. Your faithfulness reaches the skies.

5.verse: His glory is far more vast than the heavens. It towers above the earth.

6.verse: Hear the cry of your beloved child—come with mighty power and rescue me.

7.verse: God has given sacred promises; no wonder I exult! He has promised to give us all the land of Shechem and also Succoth Valley.

8.verse: “Gilead is mine to give to you,” he says, “and Manasseh as well; the land of Ephraim is the helmet on my head. Judah is my scepter.

9.verse: But Moab and Edom are despised; and I will shout in triumph over the Philistines.”

10.verse: Who but God can give me strength to conquer these fortified cities? Who else can lead me into Edom?

11.verse: Lord, have you thrown us away? Have you deserted our army?

12.verse: Oh, help us fight against our enemies, for men are useless allies.

13.verse: But with the help of God we shall do mighty acts of valor. For he treads down our foes.

1.verse: O God of my praise, don’t stand silent and aloof

2.verse: while the wicked slander me and tell their lies.

3.verse: They have no reason to hate and fight me, yet they do!

4.verse: I love them, but even while I am praying for them, they are trying to destroy me.

5.verse: They return evil for good, and hatred for love.

6.verse: Show him how it feels! Let lies be told about him, and bring him to court before an unfair judge.

7.verse: When his case is called for judgment, let him be pronounced guilty. Count his prayers as sins.

8.verse: Let his years be few and brief; let others step forward to replace him.

9.verse: May his children become fatherless and his wife a widow; may they be evicted from the ruins of their home.

10.verse: May his children become fatherless and his wife a widow; may they be evicted from the ruins of their home.

11.verse: May creditors seize his entire estate and strangers take all he has earned.

12.verse: Let no one be kind to him; let no one pity his fatherless children. May they die. May his family name be blotted out in a single generation.

13.verse: Let no one be kind to him; let no one pity his fatherless children. May they die. May his family name be blotted out in a single generation.

14.verse: Punish the sins of his father and mother. Don’t overlook them.

15.verse: Think constantly about the evil things he has done, and cut off his name from the memory of man.

16.verse: For he refused all kindness to others, and persecuted those in need, and hounded brokenhearted ones to death.

17.verse: He loved to curse others; now you curse him. He never blessed others; now don’t you bless him.

18.verse: Cursing is as much a part of him as his clothing, or as the water he drinks, or the rich food he eats.

19.verse: Now may those curses return and cling to him like his clothing or his belt.

20.verse: This is the Lord’s punishment upon my enemies who tell lies about me and threaten me with death.

21.verse: But as for me, O Lord, deal with me as your child, as one who bears your name! Because you are so kind, O Lord, deliver me.

22.verse: I am slipping down the hill to death; I am shaken off from life as easily as a man brushes a grasshopper from his arm.

23.verse: I am slipping down the hill to death; I am shaken off from life as easily as a man brushes a grasshopper from his arm.

24.verse: My knees are weak from fasting, and I am skin and bones.

25.verse: I am a symbol of failure to all mankind; when they see me they shake their heads.

26.verse: Help me, O Lord my God! Save me because you are loving and kind.

27.verse: Do it publicly, so all will see that you yourself have done it.

28.verse: Then let them curse me if they like—I won’t mind that if you are blessing me! For then all their efforts to destroy me will fail, and I shall go right on rejoicing!

29.verse: Make them fail in everything they do. Clothe them with disgrace.

30.verse: But I will give repeated thanks to the Lord, praising him to everyone.

31.verse: For he stands beside the poor and hungry to save them from their enemies.

1.verse: Jehovah said to my Lord the Messiah, “Rule as my regent—I will subdue your enemies and make them bow low before you.”

2.verse: Jehovah has established your throne in Jerusalem* to rule over your enemies.

3.verse: In that day of your power your people shall come to you willingly, dressed in holy altar robes. And your strength shall be renewed day by day like morning dew.

4.verse: Jehovah has taken oath and will not rescind his vow that you are a priest forever like Melchizedek.

5.verse: God stands beside you to protect you. He will strike down many kings in the day of his anger.

6.verse: He will punish the nations and fill them with their dead. He will crush many heads.

7.verse: But he himself shall be refreshed from springs along the way.

1.verse: Hallelujah! I want to express publicly before his people my heartfelt thanks to God for his mighty miracles. All who are thankful should ponder them with me.

2.verse: Hallelujah! I want to express publicly before his people my heartfelt thanks to God for his mighty miracles. All who are thankful should ponder them with me.

3.verse: For his miracles demonstrate his honor, majesty, and eternal goodness.

4.verse: Who can forget the wonders he performs—deeds of mercy and of grace?

5.verse: He gives food to those who trust him; he never forgets his promises.

6.verse: He has shown his great power to his people by giving them the land of Israel, though it was the home of many nations living there.

7.verse: All he does is just and good, and all his laws are right,

8.verse: for they are formed from truth and goodness and stand firm forever.

9.verse: He has paid a full ransom for his people; now they are always free to come to Jehovah (what a holy, awe-inspiring name that is).

10.verse: How can men be wise? The only way to begin is by reverence for God. For growth in wisdom comes from obeying his laws. Praise his name forever.

1.verse: Praise the Lord! For all who fear God and trust in him are blessed beyond expression. Yes, happy is the man who delights in doing his commands.

2.verse: His children shall be honored everywhere, for good men’s sons have a special heritage.

3.verse: He himself shall be wealthy, and his good deeds will never be forgotten.

4.verse: When darkness overtakes him, light will come bursting in. He is kind and merciful—

5.verse: and all goes well for the generous man who conducts his business fairly.

6.verse: Such a man will not be overthrown by evil circumstances. God’s constant care of him will make a deep impression on all who see it.

7.verse: He does not fear bad news, nor live in dread of what may happen. For he is settled in his mind that Jehovah will take care of him.

8.verse: That is why he is not afraid but can calmly face his foes.

9.verse: He gives generously to those in need. His deeds will never be forgotten. He shall have influence and honor.

10.verse: Evil-minded men will be infuriated when they see all this; they will gnash their teeth in anger and slink away, their hopes thwarted.

1.verse: Hallelujah! O servants of Jehovah, praise his name.

2.verse: Blessed is his name forever and forever.

3.verse: Praise him from sunrise to sunset!

4.verse: For he is high above the nations; his glory is far greater than the heavens.

5.verse: Who can be compared with God enthroned on high?

6.verse: Far below him are the heavens and the earth; he stoops to look,

7.verse: and lifts the poor from the dirt and the hungry from the garbage dump,

8.verse: and sets them among princes!

9.verse: He gives children to the childless wife, so that she becomes a happy mother. Hallelujah! Praise the Lord.

1.verse: Long ago when the Israelis escaped from Egypt, from that land of foreign tongue,

2.verse: then the lands of Judah and of Israel became God’s new home and kingdom.

3.verse: The Red Sea saw them coming and quickly broke apart before them. The Jordan River opened up a path for them to cross.

4.verse: The mountains skipped like rams, the little hills like lambs!

5.verse: What’s wrong, Red Sea, that made you cut yourself in two? What happened, Jordan River, to your waters? Why were they held back?

6.verse: Why, mountains, did you skip like rams? Why, little hills, like lambs?

7.verse: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, the God of Jacob.

8.verse: For he caused gushing streams to burst from flinty rock.

1.verse: Glorify your name, not ours, O Lord! Cause everyone to praise your loving-kindness and your truth.

2.verse: Why let the nations say, “Their God is dead!”

3.verse: For he is in the heavens and does as he wishes.

4.verse: Their gods are merely man-made things of silver and of gold.

5.verse: They can’t talk or see, despite their eyes and mouths!

6.verse: Nor can they hear, nor smell,

7.verse: nor use their hands or feet, nor speak!

8.verse: And those who make and worship them are just as foolish as their idols are.

9.verse: O Israel, trust the Lord! He is your helper. He is your shield.

10.verse: O priests of Aaron, trust the Lord! He is your helper; he is your shield.

11.verse: All of you, his people, trust in him. He is your helper; he is your shield.

12.verse: Jehovah is constantly thinking about us, and he will surely bless us. He will bless the people of Israel and the priests of Aaron,

13.verse: and all, both great and small, who reverence him.

14.verse: May the Lord richly bless both you and your children.

15.verse: Yes, Jehovah who made heaven and earth will personally bless you!

16.verse: The heavens belong to the Lord, but he has given the earth to all mankind.

17.verse: The dead cannot sing praises to Jehovah here on earth,

18.verse: but we can! We praise him forever! Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!

1.verse: I love the Lord because he hears my prayers and answers them.

2.verse: Because he bends down and listens, I will pray as long as I breathe!

3.verse: Death stared me in the face—I was frightened and sad.

4.verse: Then I cried, “Lord, save me!”

5.verse: How kind he is! How good he is! So merciful, this God of ours!

6.verse: The Lord protects the simple and the childlike; I was facing death, and then he saved me.

7.verse: Now I can relax. For the Lord has done this wonderful miracle for me.

8.verse: He has saved me from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.

9.verse: I shall live! Yes, in his presence—here on earth!

10.verse: In my discouragement I thought, “They are lying when they say I will recover.”

11.verse: In my discouragement I thought, “They are lying when they say I will recover.”

12.verse: But now what can I offer Jehovah for all he has done for me?

13.verse: I will bring him an offering of wine and praise his name for saving me.

14.verse: I will publicly bring him the sacrifice I vowed I would.

15.verse: His loved ones are very precious to him, and he does not lightly let them die.

16.verse: O Lord, you have freed me from my bonds, and I will serve you forever.

17.verse: I will worship you and offer you a sacrifice of thanksgiving.

18.verse: Here in the courts of the Temple in Jerusalem, before all the people, I will pay everything I vowed to the Lord. Praise the Lord.

19.verse: Here in the courts of the Temple in Jerusalem, before all the people, I will pay everything I vowed to the Lord. Praise the Lord.

1.verse: Praise the Lord, all nations everywhere. Praise him, all the peoples of the earth.

2.verse: For he loves us very dearly, and his truth endures. Praise the Lord.

1.verse: Oh, thank the Lord, for he’s so good! His loving-kindness is forever.

2.verse: Let the congregation of Israel praise him with these same words: “His loving-kindness is forever.”

3.verse: And let the priests of Aaron chant, “His loving-kindness is forever.”

4.verse: Let the Gentile converts chant, “His loving-kindness is forever.”

5.verse: In my distress I prayed to the Lord, and he answered me and rescued me.

6.verse: He is for me! How can I be afraid? What can mere man do to me?

7.verse: The Lord is on my side; he will help me. Let those who hate me beware.

8.verse: It is better to trust the Lord than to put confidence in men.

9.verse: It is better to take refuge in him than in the mightiest king!

10.verse: Though all the nations of the world attack me, I will march out behind his banner and destroy them.

11.verse: Yes, they surround and attack me; but with his flag flying above me I will cut them off.

12.verse: They swarm around me like bees; they blaze against me like a roaring flame. Yet beneath his flag I shall destroy them.

13.verse: You did your best to kill me, O my enemy, but the Lord helped me.

14.verse: He is my strength and song in the heat of battle, and now he has given me the victory.

15.verse: Songs of joy at the news of our rescue are sung in the homes of the godly. The strong arm of the Lord has done glorious things!

16.verse: Songs of joy at the news of our rescue are sung in the homes of the godly. The strong arm of the Lord has done glorious things!

17.verse: I shall not die but live to tell of all his deeds.

18.verse: The Lord has punished me but not handed me over to death.

19.verse: Open the gates of the Temple—I will go in and give him my thanks.

20.verse: Those gates are the way into the presence of the Lord, and the godly enter there.

21.verse: O Lord, thank you so much for answering my prayer and saving me.

22.verse: The stone rejected by the builders has now become the capstone of the arch!

23.verse: This is the Lord’s doing, and it is marvelous to see!

24.verse: This is the day the Lord has made. We will rejoice and be glad in it.

25.verse: O Lord, please help us. Save us. Give us success.

26.verse: Blessed is the one who is coming, the one sent by the Lord. We bless you from the Temple.

27.verse: Jehovah God is our light. I present to him my sacrifice upon the altar, for you are my God, and I shall give you this thanks and this praise.

28.verse: Jehovah God is our light. I present to him my sacrifice upon the altar, for you are my God, and I shall give you this thanks and this praise.

29.verse: Oh, give thanks to the Lord, for he is so good! For his loving-kindness is forever.

1.verse: Happy are all who perfectly follow the laws of God.

2.verse: Happy are all who search for God and always do his will,

3.verse: rejecting compromise with evil and walking only in his paths.

4.verse: You have given us your laws to obey—

5.verse: oh, how I want to follow them consistently.

6.verse: Then I will not be disgraced, for I will have a clean record.

7.verse: After you have corrected me, I will thank you by living as I should!

8.verse: I will obey! Oh, don’t forsake me and let me slip back into sin again.

9.verse: How can a young man stay pure? By reading your Word and following its rules.

10.verse: I have tried my best to find you—don’t let me wander off from your instructions.

11.verse: I have thought much about your words and stored them in my heart so that they would hold me back from sin.

12.verse: Blessed Lord, teach me your rules.

13.verse: I have recited your laws

14.verse: and rejoiced in them more than in riches.

15.verse: I will meditate upon them and give them my full respect.

16.verse: I will delight in them and not forget them.

17.verse: Bless me with life so that I can continue to obey you.

18.verse: Open my eyes to see wonderful things in your Word.

19.verse: I am but a pilgrim here on earth: how I need a map—and your commands are my chart and guide.

20.verse: I long for your instructions more than I can tell.

21.verse: You rebuke those cursed proud ones who refuse your commands—

22.verse: don’t let them scorn me for obeying you.

23.verse: For even princes sit and talk against me, but I will continue in your plans.

24.verse: Your laws are both my light and my counselors.

25.verse: I am completely discouraged—I lie in the dust. Revive me by your Word.

26.verse: I told you my plans and you replied. Now give me your instructions.

27.verse: Make me understand what you want; for then I shall see your miracles.

28.verse: I weep with grief; my heart is heavy with sorrow; encourage and cheer me with your words.

29.verse: Keep me far from every wrong; help me, undeserving as I am, to obey your laws, for I have chosen to do right.

30.verse: Keep me far from every wrong; help me, undeserving as I am, to obey your laws, for I have chosen to do right.

31.verse: I cling to your commands and follow them as closely as I can. Lord, don’t let me make a mess of things.

32.verse: If you will only help me to want your will, then I will follow your laws even more closely.

33.verse: Just tell me what to do and I will do it, Lord. As long as I live I’ll wholeheartedly obey.

34.verse: Just tell me what to do and I will do it, Lord. As long as I live I’ll wholeheartedly obey.

35.verse: Make me walk along the right paths, for I know how delightful they really are.

36.verse: Help me to prefer obedience to making money!

37.verse: Turn me away from wanting any other plan than yours. Revive my heart toward you.

38.verse: Reassure me that your promises are for me, for I trust and revere you.

39.verse: How I dread being mocked for obeying, for your laws are right and good.

40.verse: I long to obey them! Therefore in fairness renew my life, for this was your promise—yes, Lord, to save me! Now spare me by your kindness and your love. Then I will have an answer for those who taunt me, for I trust your promises.

41.verse: I long to obey them! Therefore in fairness renew my life, for this was your promise—yes, Lord, to save me! Now spare me by your kindness and your love. Then I will have an answer for those who taunt me, for I trust your promises.

42.verse: I long to obey them! Therefore in fairness renew my life, for this was your promise—yes, Lord, to save me! Now spare me by your kindness and your love. Then I will have an answer for those who taunt me, for I trust your promises.

43.verse: May I never forget your words, for they are my only hope.

44.verse: Therefore I will keep on obeying you forever and forever, free within the limits of your laws. I will speak to kings about their value, and they will listen with interest and respect.

45.verse: Therefore I will keep on obeying you forever and forever, free within the limits of your laws. I will speak to kings about their value, and they will listen with interest and respect.

46.verse: Therefore I will keep on obeying you forever and forever, free within the limits of your laws. I will speak to kings about their value, and they will listen with interest and respect.

47.verse: How I love your laws! How I enjoy your commands!

48.verse: “Come, come to me,” I call to them, for I love them and will let them fill my life.

49.verse: Never forget your promises to me your servant, for they are my only hope. They give me strength in all my troubles; how they refresh and revive me!

50.verse: Never forget your promises to me your servant, for they are my only hope. They give me strength in all my troubles; how they refresh and revive me!

51.verse: Proud men hold me in contempt for obedience to God, but I stand unmoved.

52.verse: From my earliest youth I have tried to obey you; your Word has been my comfort.

53.verse: I am very angry with those who spurn your commands.

54.verse: For these laws of yours have been my source of joy and singing through all these years of my earthly pilgrimage.

55.verse: I obey them even at night and keep my thoughts, O Lord, on you.

56.verse: What a blessing this has been to me—to constantly obey.

57.verse: Jehovah is mine! And I promise to obey!

58.verse: With all my heart I want your blessings. Be merciful just as you promised.

59.verse: I thought about the wrong direction in which I was headed, and turned around and came running back to you.

60.verse: I thought about the wrong direction in which I was headed, and turned around and came running back to you.

61.verse: Evil men have tried to drag me into sin, but I am firmly anchored to your laws.

62.verse: At midnight I will rise to give my thanks to you for your good laws.

63.verse: Anyone is my brother who fears and trusts the Lord and obeys him.

64.verse: O Lord, the earth is full of your loving-kindness! Teach me your good paths.

65.verse: Lord, I am overflowing with your blessings, just as you promised.

66.verse: Now teach me good judgment as well as knowledge. For your laws are my guide.

67.verse: I used to wander off until you punished me; now I closely follow all you say.

68.verse: You are good and do only good; make me follow your lead.

69.verse: Proud men have made up lies about me, but the truth is that I obey your laws with all my heart.

70.verse: Their minds are dull and stupid, but I have sense enough to follow you.

71.verse: The punishment you gave me was the best thing that could have happened to me, for it taught me to pay attention to your laws. They are more valuable to me than millions in silver and gold!

72.verse: The punishment you gave me was the best thing that could have happened to me, for it taught me to pay attention to your laws. They are more valuable to me than millions in silver and gold!

73.verse: You made my body, Lord; now give me sense to heed your laws.

74.verse: All those who fear and trust in you will welcome me because I too am trusting in your Word.

75.verse: I know, O Lord, that your decisions are right and that your punishment was right and did me good. Now let your loving-kindness comfort me, just as you promised. Surround me with your tender mercies that I may live. For your law is my delight.

76.verse: I know, O Lord, that your decisions are right and that your punishment was right and did me good. Now let your loving-kindness comfort me, just as you promised. Surround me with your tender mercies that I may live. For your law is my delight.

77.verse: I know, O Lord, that your decisions are right and that your punishment was right and did me good. Now let your loving-kindness comfort me, just as you promised. Surround me with your tender mercies that I may live. For your law is my delight.

78.verse: Let the proud be disgraced, for they have cut me down with all their lies. But I will concentrate my thoughts upon your laws.

79.verse: Let all others join me who trust and fear you, and we will discuss your laws.

80.verse: Help me to love your every wish; then I will never have to be ashamed of myself.

81.verse: I faint for your salvation; but I expect your help, for you have promised it.

82.verse: My eyes are straining to see your promises come true. When will you comfort me with your help?

83.verse: I am shriveled like a wineskin in the smoke, exhausted with waiting. But still I cling to your laws and obey them.

84.verse: How long must I wait before you punish those who persecute me?

85.verse: These proud men who hate your truth and laws have dug deep pits for me to fall in. Their lies have brought me into deep trouble. Help me, for you love only truth.

86.verse: These proud men who hate your truth and laws have dug deep pits for me to fall in. Their lies have brought me into deep trouble. Help me, for you love only truth.

87.verse: They had almost finished me off, yet I refused to yield and disobey your laws.

88.verse: In your kindness, spare my life; then I can continue to obey you.

89.verse: Forever, O Lord, your Word stands firm in heaven.

90.verse: Your faithfulness extends to every generation, like the earth you created; it endures by your decree, for everything serves your plans.

91.verse: Your faithfulness extends to every generation, like the earth you created; it endures by your decree, for everything serves your plans.

92.verse: I would have despaired and perished unless your laws had been my deepest delight.

93.verse: I will never lay aside your laws, for you have used them to restore my joy and health.

94.verse: I am yours! Save me! For I have tried to live according to your desires.

95.verse: Though the wicked hide along the way to kill me, I will quietly keep my mind upon your promises.

96.verse: Nothing is perfect except your words.

97.verse: Oh, how I love them. I think about them all day long.

98.verse: They make me wiser than my enemies because they are my constant guide.

99.verse: Yes, wiser than my teachers, for I am ever thinking of your rules.

100.verse: They make me even wiser than the aged.

101.verse: I have refused to walk the paths of evil, for I will remain obedient to your Word.

102.verse: No, I haven’t turned away from what you taught me; your words are sweeter than honey.

103.verse: No, I haven’t turned away from what you taught me; your words are sweeter than honey.

104.verse: And since only your rules can give me wisdom and understanding, no wonder I hate every false teaching.

105.verse: Your words are a flashlight to light the path ahead of me and keep me from stumbling.

106.verse: I’ve said it once and I’ll say it again and again: I will obey these wonderful laws of yours.

107.verse: I am close to death at the hands of my enemies; oh, give me back my life again, just as you promised me.

108.verse: Accept my grateful thanks and teach me your desires.

109.verse: My life hangs in the balance, but I will not give up obedience to your laws.

110.verse: The wicked have set their traps for me along your path, but I will not turn aside.

111.verse: Your laws are my joyous treasure forever.

112.verse: I am determined to obey you until I die.

113.verse: I hate those who are undecided whether or not to obey you; but my choice is clear—I love your law.

114.verse: You are my refuge and my shield, and your promises are my only source of hope.

115.verse: Begone, you evil-minded men! Don’t try to stop me from obeying God’s commands.

116.verse: Lord, you promised to let me live! Never let it be said that God failed me.

117.verse: Hold me safe above the heads of all my enemies; then I can continue to obey your laws.

118.verse: But you have rejected all who reject your laws. They are only fooling themselves.

119.verse: The wicked are the scum you skim off and throw away; no wonder I love to obey your laws!

120.verse: I tremble in fear of you; I fear your punishments.

121.verse: Don’t leave me to the mercy of my enemies, for I have done what is right; I’ve been perfectly fair.

122.verse: Commit yourself to bless me! Don’t let the proud oppress me!

123.verse: My eyes grow dim with longing for you to fulfill your wonderful promise to rescue me.

124.verse: Lord, deal with me in loving-kindness, and teach me, your servant, to obey;

125.verse: for I am your servant; therefore give me common sense to apply your rules to everything I do.

126.verse: Lord, it is time for you to act. For these evil men have violated your laws,

127.verse: while I love your commandments more than the finest gold.

128.verse: Every law of God is right, whatever it concerns. I hate every other way.

129.verse: Your laws are wonderful; no wonder I obey them.

130.verse: As your plan unfolds, even the simple can understand it.

131.verse: No wonder I wait expectantly for each of your commands.

132.verse: Come and have mercy on me as is your way with those who love you.

133.verse: Guide me with your laws so that I will not be overcome by evil.

134.verse: Rescue me from the oppression of evil men; then I can obey you.

135.verse: Look down in love upon me and teach me all your laws.

136.verse: I weep because your laws are disobeyed.

137.verse: O Lord, you are just and your punishments are fair.

138.verse: Your demands are just and right.

139.verse: I am indignant and angry because of the way my enemies have disregarded your laws.

140.verse: I have thoroughly tested your promises, and that is why I love them so much.

141.verse: I am worthless and despised, but I don’t despise your laws.

142.verse: Your justice is eternal for your laws are perfectly fair.

143.verse: In my distress and anguish your commandments comfort me.

144.verse: Your laws are always fair; help me to understand them, and I shall live.

145.verse: I am praying with great earnestness; answer me, O Lord, and I will obey your laws.

146.verse: “Save me,” I cry, “for I am obeying.”

147.verse: Early in the morning before the sun is up, I am praying and pointing out how much I trust in you.

148.verse: I stay awake through the night to think about your promises.

149.verse: Because you are so loving and kind, listen to me and make me well again.

150.verse: Here come these lawless men to attack me,

151.verse: but you are near, O Lord; all your commandments are based on truth.

152.verse: I have known from earliest days that your will never changes.

153.verse: Look down upon my sorrows and rescue me, for I am obeying your commands.

154.verse: Yes, rescue me and give me back my life again just as you have promised.

155.verse: The wicked are far from salvation, for they do not care for your laws.

156.verse: Lord, how great is your mercy; oh, give me back my life again.

157.verse: My enemies are so many. They try to make me disobey, but I have not swerved from your will.

158.verse: I loathed these traitors because they care nothing for your laws.

159.verse: Lord, see how much I really love your demands. Now give me back my life and health because you are so kind.

160.verse: There is utter truth in all your laws; your decrees are eternal.

161.verse: Great men have persecuted me, though they have no reason to, but I stand in awe of only your words.

162.verse: I rejoice in your laws like one who finds a great treasure.

163.verse: How I hate all falsehood, but how I love your laws.

164.verse: I will praise you seven times a day because of your wonderful laws.

165.verse: Those who love your laws have great peace of heart and mind and do not stumble.

166.verse: I long for your salvation, Lord, and so I have obeyed your laws.

167.verse: I have looked for your commandments, and I love them very much;

168.verse: yes, I have searched for them. You know this because everything I do is known to you.

169.verse: O Lord, listen to my prayers; give me the common sense you promised.

170.verse: Hear my prayers; rescue me as you said you would.

171.verse: I praise you for letting me learn your laws.

172.verse: I will sing about their wonder, for each of them is just.

173.verse: Stand ready to help me because I have chosen to follow your will.

174.verse: O Lord, I have longed for your salvation, and your law is my delight.

175.verse: If you will let me live, I will praise you; let your laws assist me.

176.verse: I have wandered away like a lost sheep; come and find me, for I have not turned away from your commandments.

1.verse: In my troubles I pled with God to help me and he did!

2.verse: Deliver me, O Lord, from liars.

3.verse: O lying tongue, what shall be your fate?

4.verse: You shall be pierced with sharp arrows and burned with glowing coals.

5.verse: My troubles pile high among these haters of the Lord, these men of Meshech and Kedar. I am tired of being here among these men who hate peace.

6.verse: My troubles pile high among these haters of the Lord, these men of Meshech and Kedar. I am tired of being here among these men who hate peace.

7.verse: I am for peace, but they are for war, and my voice goes unheeded in their councils.

1.verse: Shall I look to the mountain gods for help?

2.verse: No! My help is from Jehovah who made the mountains! And the heavens too!

3.verse: He will never let me stumble, slip, or fall. For he is always watching, never sleeping.

4.verse: He will never let me stumble, slip, or fall. For he is always watching, never sleeping.

5.verse: Jehovah himself is caring for you! He is your defender.

6.verse: He protects you day and night.

7.verse: He keeps you from all evil and preserves your life.

8.verse: He keeps his eye upon you as you come and go and always guards you.

1.verse: I was glad for the suggestion of going to Jerusalem, to the Temple of the Lord.

2.verse: Now we are standing here inside the crowded city.

3.verse: Now we are standing here inside the crowded city.

4.verse: All Israel—Jehovah’s people—have come to worship as the law requires, to thank and praise the Lord.

5.verse: Look! There are the judges holding court beside the city gates, deciding all the people’s arguments.

6.verse: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem. May all who love this city prosper.

7.verse: O Jerusalem, may there be peace within your walls and prosperity in your palaces.

8.verse: This I ask for the sake of all my brothers and my friends who live here;

9.verse: and may there be peace as a protection to the Temple of the Lord.

1.verse: O God enthroned in heaven, I lift my eyes to you.

2.verse: We look to Jehovah our God for his mercy and kindness just as a servant keeps his eyes upon his master or a slave girl watches her mistress for the slightest signal.

3.verse: Have mercy on us, Lord, have mercy. For we have had our fill of contempt and of the scoffing of the rich and proud.

4.verse: Have mercy on us, Lord, have mercy. For we have had our fill of contempt and of the scoffing of the rich and proud.

1.verse: If the Lord had not been on our side (let all Israel admit it), if the Lord had not been on our side,

2.verse: we would have been swallowed alive by our enemies, destroyed by their anger.

3.verse: we would have been swallowed alive by our enemies, destroyed by their anger.

4.verse: We would have drowned beneath the flood of these men’s fury and pride.

5.verse: We would have drowned beneath the flood of these men’s fury and pride.

6.verse: Blessed be Jehovah who has not let them devour us.

7.verse: We have escaped with our lives as a bird from a hunter’s snare. The snare is broken and we are free!

8.verse: Our help is from the Lord who made heaven and earth.

1.verse: Those who trust in the Lord are steady as Mount Zion, unmoved by any circumstance.

2.verse: Just as the mountains surround and protect Jerusalem, so the Lord surrounds and protects his people.

3.verse: For the wicked shall not rule the godly, lest the godly be forced to do wrong.

4.verse: O Lord, do good to those who are good, whose hearts are right with the Lord;

5.verse: but lead evil men to execution. And let Israel have quietness and peace.

1.verse: When Jehovah brought back his exiles to Jerusalem, it was like a dream!

2.verse: How we laughed and sang for joy. And the other nations said, “What amazing things the Lord has done for them.”

3.verse: Yes, glorious things! What wonder! What joy!

4.verse: May we be refreshed as by streams in the desert.

5.verse: Those who sow tears shall reap joy.

6.verse: Yes, they go out weeping, carrying seed for sowing, and return singing, carrying their sheaves.

1.verse: Unless the Lord builds a house, the builders’ work is useless. Unless the Lord protects a city, sentries do no good.

2.verse: It is senseless for you to work so hard from early morning until late at night, fearing you will starve to death; for God wants his loved ones to get their proper rest.

3.verse: Children are a gift from God; they are his reward.

4.verse: Children born to a young man are like sharp arrows to defend him.

5.verse: Happy is the man who has his quiver full of them. That man shall have the help he needs when arguing with his enemies.

1.verse: Blessings on all who reverence and trust the Lord—on all who obey him!

2.verse: Their reward shall be prosperity and happiness.

3.verse: Your wife shall be contented in your home. And look at all those children! There they sit around the dinner table as vigorous and healthy as young olive trees.

4.verse: That is God’s reward to those who reverence and trust him.

5.verse: May the Lord continually bless you with heaven’s blessings as well as with human joys.*

6.verse: May you live to enjoy your grandchildren! And may God bless Israel!

1.verse: Persecuted from my earliest youth (Israel is speaking),

2.verse: and faced with never-ending discrimination—but not destroyed! My enemies have never been able to finish me off!

3.verse: Though my back is cut to ribbons with their whips, the Lord is good. For he has snapped the chains that evil men had bound me with.

4.verse: Though my back is cut to ribbons with their whips, the Lord is good. For he has snapped the chains that evil men had bound me with.

5.verse: May all who hate the Jews be brought to ignominious defeat.

6.verse: May they be as grass in shallow soil, turning sere and yellow when half grown, ignored by the reaper, despised by the binder.

7.verse: May they be as grass in shallow soil, turning sere and yellow when half grown, ignored by the reaper, despised by the binder.

8.verse: And may those passing by refuse to bless them by saying, “Jehovah’s blessings be upon you; we bless you in Jehovah’s name.”

1.verse: O Lord, from the depths of despair I cry for your help:

2.verse: “Hear me! Answer! Help me!”

3.verse: Lord, if you keep in mind our sins, then who can ever get an answer to his prayers? But you forgive! What an awesome thing this is!

4.verse: Lord, if you keep in mind our sins, then who can ever get an answer to his prayers? But you forgive! What an awesome thing this is!

5.verse: That is why I wait expectantly, trusting God to help, for he has promised.

6.verse: I long for him more than sentinels long for the dawn.

7.verse: O Israel, hope in the Lord; for he is loving and kind and comes to us with armloads of salvation.

8.verse: He himself shall ransom Israel from her slavery to sin.

1.verse: Lord, I am not proud and haughty. I don’t think myself better than others. I don’t pretend to “know it all.”

2.verse: I am quiet now before the Lord, just as a child who is weaned from the breast. Yes, my begging has been stilled.

3.verse: O Israel, you too should quietly trust in the Lord—now, and always.

1.verse: Lord, do you remember that time when my heart was so filled with turmoil?

2.verse: I couldn’t rest, I couldn’t sleep, thinking how I ought to build a permanent home for the Ark of the Lord, a Temple for the Mighty One of Israel. Then I vowed that I would do it; I made a solemn promise to the Lord.

3.verse: I couldn’t rest, I couldn’t sleep, thinking how I ought to build a permanent home for the Ark of the Lord, a Temple for the Mighty One of Israel. Then I vowed that I would do it; I made a solemn promise to the Lord.

4.verse: I couldn’t rest, I couldn’t sleep, thinking how I ought to build a permanent home for the Ark of the Lord, a Temple for the Mighty One of Israel. Then I vowed that I would do it; I made a solemn promise to the Lord.

5.verse: I couldn’t rest, I couldn’t sleep, thinking how I ought to build a permanent home for the Ark of the Lord, a Temple for the Mighty One of Israel. Then I vowed that I would do it; I made a solemn promise to the Lord.

6.verse: First the Ark was in Ephrathah, then in the distant countryside of Jaar.

7.verse: But now it will be settled in the Temple, in God’s permanent home here on earth. That is where we will go to worship him.

8.verse: Arise, O Lord, and enter your Temple with the Ark, the symbol of your power.

9.verse: We will clothe the priests in white, the symbol of all purity. May our nation shout for joy.

10.verse: Do not reject your servant David—the king you chose for your people.

11.verse: For you promised me that my son would sit on my throne and succeed me. And surely you will never go back on a promise!

12.verse: You also promised that if my descendants will obey the terms of your contract with me, then the dynasty of David shall never end.

13.verse: O Lord, you have chosen Jerusalem as your home:

14.verse: “This is my permanent home where I shall live,” you said, “for I have always wanted it this way.

15.verse: I will make this city prosperous and satisfy her poor with food.

16.verse: I will clothe her priests with salvation; her saints shall shout for joy.

17.verse: David’s power shall grow, for I have decreed for him a mighty Son.

18.verse: I’ll clothe his enemies with shame, but he shall be a glorious King.”

1.verse: How wonderful it is, how pleasant, when brothers live in harmony!

2.verse: For harmony is as precious as the fragrant anointing oil that was poured over Aaron’s head and ran down onto his beard and onto the border of his robe.

3.verse: Harmony is as refreshing as the dew on Mount Hermon, on the mountains of Israel. And God has pronounced this eternal blessing on Jerusalem, even life forevermore.

1.verse: Oh, bless the Lord, you who serve him as watchmen in the Temple every night.

2.verse: Lift your hands in holiness and bless the Lord.

3.verse: The Lord bless you from Zion—the Lord who made heaven and earth.

1.verse: Hallelujah!

2.verse: Yes, let his people praise him as they stand in his Temple courts.

3.verse: Praise the Lord because he is so good; sing to his wonderful name.

4.verse: For the Lord has chosen Israel as his personal possession.

5.verse: I know the greatness of the Lord—that he is greater far than any other god.

6.verse: He does whatever pleases him throughout all of heaven and earth and in the deepest seas.

7.verse: He makes mists rise throughout the earth; he sends the lightning to bring down the rain and sends the winds from his treasuries.

8.verse: He destroyed the eldest child in each Egyptian home, along with the firstborn of the flocks.

9.verse: He did great miracles in Egypt before Pharaoh and all his people.

10.verse: He smote great nations, slaying mighty kings—

11.verse: Sihon, king of Amorites; and Og, the king of Bashan; and the kings of Canaan—

12.verse: and gave their land as an eternal gift to his people Israel.

13.verse: O Jehovah, your name endures forever; your fame is known to every generation.

14.verse: For Jehovah will vindicate his people and have compassion on his servants.

15.verse: The heathen worship idols of gold and silver made by men—

16.verse: idols with speechless mouths, sightless eyes,

17.verse: and ears that cannot hear; they cannot even breathe.

18.verse: Those who make them become like them! And so do all who trust in them!

19.verse: O Israel, bless Jehovah! High Priests of Aaron, bless his name.

20.verse: O Levite priests, bless the Lord Jehovah! Oh, bless his name, all of you who trust and reverence him.

21.verse: All people of Jerusalem, praise the Lord, for he lives here in Jerusalem. Hallelujah!

1.verse: Oh, give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his loving-kindness continues forever.

2.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

3.verse: Give thanks to the Lord of lords, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

4.verse: Praise him who alone does mighty miracles, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

5.verse: Praise him who made the heavens, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

6.verse: Praise him who planted the water within the earth, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

7.verse: Praise him who made the heavenly lights, for his loving-kindness continues forever:

8.verse: the sun to rule the day, for his loving-kindness continues forever;

9.verse: and the moon and stars at night, for his loving-kindness continues forever.
