10.verse: Praise the God who smote the firstborn of Egypt, for his loving-kindness to Israel continues forever.

11.verse: He brought them out with mighty power and upraised fist to strike their enemies, for his loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever.

12.verse: He brought them out with mighty power and upraised fist to strike their enemies, for his loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever.

13.verse: Praise the Lord who opened the Red Sea to make a path before them, for his loving-kindness continues forever,

14.verse: and led them safely through, for his loving-kindness continues forever—

15.verse: but drowned Pharaoh’s army in the sea, for his loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever.

16.verse: Praise him who led his people through the wilderness, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

17.verse: Praise him who saved his people from the power of mighty kings, for his loving-kindness continues forever,

18.verse: and killed famous kings who were their enemies, for his loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever:

19.verse: Sihon, king of Amorites—for God’s loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever—

20.verse: and Og, king of Bashan—for his loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever.

21.verse: God gave the land of these kings to Israel as a gift forever, for his loving-kindness to Israel* continues forever;

22.verse: yes, a permanent gift to his servant Israel, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

23.verse: He remembered our utter weakness, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

24.verse: And saved us from our foes, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

25.verse: He gives food to every living thing, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

26.verse: Oh, give thanks to the God of heaven, for his loving-kindness continues forever.

1.verse: Weeping, we sat beside the rivers of Babylon thinking of Jerusalem.

2.verse: We have put away our lyres, hanging them upon the branches of the willow trees,

3.verse: for how can we sing? Yet our captors, our tormentors, demand that we sing for them the happy songs of Zion!

4.verse: for how can we sing? Yet our captors, our tormentors, demand that we sing for them the happy songs of Zion!

5.verse: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill upon the harp. If I fail to love her more than my highest joy, let me never sing again.

6.verse: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget its skill upon the harp. If I fail to love her more than my highest joy, let me never sing again.

7.verse: O Jehovah, do not forget what these Edomites did on that day when the armies of Babylon captured Jerusalem. “Raze her to the ground!” they yelled.

8.verse: O Babylon, evil beast, you shall be destroyed. Blessed is the man who destroys you as you have destroyed us.

9.verse: Blessed is the man who takes your babies and smashes them against the rocks!

1.verse: Lord, with all my heart I thank you. I will sing your praises before the armies of angels.

2.verse: I face your Temple as I worship, giving thanks to you for all your loving-kindness and your faithfulness, for your promises are backed by all the honor of your name.

3.verse: When I pray, you answer me and encourage me by giving me the strength I need.

4.verse: Every king in all the earth shall give you thanks, O Lord, for all of them shall hear your voice.

5.verse: Yes, they shall sing about Jehovah’s glorious ways, for his glory is very great.

6.verse: Yet though he is so great, he respects the humble, but proud men must keep their distance.

7.verse: Though I am surrounded by troubles, you will bring me safely through them. You will clench your fist against my angry enemies! Your power will save me.

8.verse: The Lord will work out his plans for my life—for your loving-kindness, Lord, continues forever. Don’t abandon me—for you made me.

1.verse: O Lord, you have examined my heart and know everything about me.

2.verse: You know when I sit or stand. When far away you know my every thought.

3.verse: You chart the path ahead of me and tell me where to stop and rest. Every moment you know where I am.

4.verse: You know what I am going to say before I even say it.

5.verse: You both precede and follow me and place your hand of blessing on my head.

6.verse: This is too glorious, too wonderful to believe!

7.verse: I can never be lost to your Spirit! I can never get away from my God!

8.verse: If I go up to heaven, you are there; if I go down to the place of the dead, you are there.

9.verse: If I ride the morning winds to the farthest oceans,

10.verse: even there your hand will guide me, your strength will support me.

11.verse: If I try to hide in the darkness, the night becomes light around me.

12.verse: For even darkness cannot hide from God; to you the night shines as bright as day. Darkness and light are both alike to you.

13.verse: You made all the delicate, inner parts of my body and knit them together in my mother’s womb.

14.verse: Thank you for making me so wonderfully complex! It is amazing to think about. Your workmanship is marvelous—and how well I know it.

15.verse: You were there while I was being formed in utter seclusion!

16.verse: You saw me before I was born and scheduled each day of my life before I began to breathe. Every day was recorded in your book!

17.verse: How precious it is, Lord, to realize that you are thinking about me constantly! I can’t even count how many times a day your thoughts turn toward me. And when I waken in the morning, you are still thinking of me!

18.verse: How precious it is, Lord, to realize that you are thinking about me constantly! I can’t even count how many times a day your thoughts turn toward me. And when I waken in the morning, you are still thinking of me!

19.verse: Surely you will slay the wicked, Lord! Away, bloodthirsty men! Begone!

20.verse: They blaspheme your name and stand in arrogance against you—how silly can they be?

21.verse: O Lord, shouldn’t I hate those who hate you? Shouldn’t I be grieved with them?

22.verse: Yes, I hate them, for your enemies are my enemies too.

23.verse: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test my thoughts.

24.verse: Point out anything you find in me that makes you sad, and lead me along the path of everlasting life.

1.verse: O Lord, deliver me from evil men. Preserve me from the violent,

2.verse: who plot and stir up trouble all day long.

3.verse: Their words sting like poisonous snakes.

4.verse: Keep me out of their power. Preserve me from their violence, for they are plotting against me.

5.verse: These proud men have set a trap to catch me, a noose to yank me up and leave me dangling in the air; they wait in ambush with a net to throw over and hold me helpless in its meshes.

6.verse: O Jehovah, my Lord and Savior, my God and my shield—hear me as I pray! Don’t let these wicked men succeed; don’t let them prosper and be proud.

7.verse: O Jehovah, my Lord and Savior, my God and my shield—hear me as I pray! Don’t let these wicked men succeed; don’t let them prosper and be proud.

8.verse: O Jehovah, my Lord and Savior, my God and my shield—hear me as I pray! Don’t let these wicked men succeed; don’t let them prosper and be proud.

9.verse: Let their plots boomerang! Let them be destroyed by the very evil they have planned for me.

10.verse: Let burning coals fall down upon their heads, or throw them into the fire or into deep pits from which they can’t escape.

11.verse: Don’t let liars prosper here in our land; quickly punish them.

12.verse: But the Lord will surely help those they persecute; he will maintain the rights of the poor.

13.verse: Surely the godly are thanking you, for they shall live in your presence.

1.verse: Quick, Lord, answer me—for I have prayed. Listen when I cry to you for help!

2.verse: Regard my prayer as my evening sacrifice and as incense wafting up to you.

3.verse: Help me, Lord, to keep my mouth shut and my lips sealed.

4.verse: Take away my lust for evil things; don’t let me want to be with sinners, doing what they do, sharing their delicacies.

5.verse: Let the godly smite me! It will be a kindness! If they reprove me, it is medicine! Don’t let me refuse it. But I am in constant prayer against the wicked and their deeds.

6.verse: When their leaders are condemned, and their bones are strewn across the ground, then these men will finally listen to me and know that I am trying to help them.

7.verse: When their leaders are condemned, and their bones are strewn across the ground, then these men will finally listen to me and know that I am trying to help them.

8.verse: I look to you for help, O Lord God. You are my refuge. Don’t let them slay me.

9.verse: Keep me out of their traps.

10.verse: Let them fall into their own snares, while I escape.

1.verse: How I plead with God, how I implore his mercy, pouring out my troubles before him.

2.verse: How I plead with God, how I implore his mercy, pouring out my troubles before him.

3.verse: For I am overwhelmed and desperate, and you alone know which way I ought to turn to miss the traps my enemies have set for me.

4.verse: (There’s one—just over there to the right!) No one gives me a passing thought. No one will help me; no one cares a bit what happens to me.

5.verse: Then I prayed to Jehovah. “Lord,” I pled, “you are my only place of refuge. Only you can keep me safe.

6.verse: “Hear my cry, for I am very low. Rescue me from my persecutors, for they are too strong for me.

7.verse: Bring me out of prison so that I can thank you. The godly will rejoice with me for all your help.”

1.verse: Hear my prayer, O Lord; answer my plea because you are faithful to your promises.

2.verse: Don’t bring me to trial! For as compared with you, no one is perfect.

3.verse: My enemies chased and caught me. They have knocked me to the ground. They force me to live in the darkness like those in the grave.

4.verse: I am losing all hope; I am paralyzed with fear.

5.verse: I remember the glorious miracles you did in days of long ago.

6.verse: I reach out for you. I thirst for you as parched land thirsts for rain.

7.verse: Come quickly, Lord, and answer me, for my depression deepens; don’t turn away from me or I shall die.

8.verse: Let me see your kindness to me in the morning, for I am trusting you. Show me where to walk, for my prayer is sincere.

9.verse: Save me from my enemies. O Lord, I run to you to hide me.

10.verse: Help me to do your will, for you are my God. Lead me in good paths, for your Spirit is good.

11.verse: Lord, saving me will bring glory to your name. Bring me out of all this trouble because you are true to your promises.

12.verse: And because you are loving and kind to me, cut off all my enemies and destroy those who are trying to harm me; for I am your servant.

1.verse: Bless the Lord who is my immovable Rock. He gives me strength and skill in battle.

2.verse: He is always kind and loving to me; he is my fortress, my tower of strength and safety, my deliverer. He stands before me as a shield. He subdues my people under me.

3.verse: O Lord, what is man that you even notice him? Why bother at all with the human race?

4.verse: For man is but a breath; his days are like a passing shadow.

5.verse: Bend down the heavens, Lord, and come. The mountains smoke beneath your touch.

6.verse: Let loose your lightning bolts, your arrows, Lord, upon your enemies, and scatter them.

7.verse: Reach down from heaven and rescue me; deliver me from deep waters, from the power of my enemies.

8.verse: Their mouths are filled with lies; they swear to the truth of what is false.

9.verse: I will sing you a new song, O God, with a ten-stringed harp.

10.verse: For you grant victory to kings! You are the one who will rescue your servant David from the fatal sword.

11.verse: Save me! Deliver me from these enemies, these liars, these treacherous men.

12.verse: Here is my description of a truly happy land where Jehovah is God: Sons vigorous and tall as growing plants. Daughters of graceful beauty like the pillars of a palace wall. Barns full to the brim with crops of every kind. Sheep by the thousands out in our fields. Oxen loaded down with produce. No enemy attacking the walls, but peace everywhere. No crime in our streets. Yes, happy are those whose God is Jehovah.

13.verse: Here is my description of a truly happy land where Jehovah is God: Sons vigorous and tall as growing plants. Daughters of graceful beauty like the pillars of a palace wall. Barns full to the brim with crops of every kind. Sheep by the thousands out in our fields. Oxen loaded down with produce. No enemy attacking the walls, but peace everywhere. No crime in our streets. Yes, happy are those whose God is Jehovah.

14.verse: Here is my description of a truly happy land where Jehovah is God: Sons vigorous and tall as growing plants. Daughters of graceful beauty like the pillars of a palace wall. Barns full to the brim with crops of every kind. Sheep by the thousands out in our fields. Oxen loaded down with produce. No enemy attacking the walls, but peace everywhere. No crime in our streets. Yes, happy are those whose God is Jehovah.

15.verse: Here is my description of a truly happy land where Jehovah is God: Sons vigorous and tall as growing plants. Daughters of graceful beauty like the pillars of a palace wall. Barns full to the brim with crops of every kind. Sheep by the thousands out in our fields. Oxen loaded down with produce. No enemy attacking the walls, but peace everywhere. No crime in our streets. Yes, happy are those whose God is Jehovah.

1.verse: I will praise you, my God and King, and bless your name each day and forever.

2.verse: I will praise you, my God and King, and bless your name each day and forever.

3.verse: Great is Jehovah! Greatly praise him! His greatness is beyond discovery!

4.verse: Let each generation tell its children what glorious things he does.

5.verse: I will meditate about your glory, splendor, majesty, and miracles.

6.verse: Your awe-inspiring deeds shall be on every tongue; I will proclaim your greatness.

7.verse: Everyone will tell about how good you are and sing about your righteousness.

8.verse: Jehovah is kind and merciful, slow to get angry, full of love.

9.verse: He is good to everyone, and his compassion is intertwined with everything he does.

10.verse: All living things shall thank you, Lord, and your people will bless you.

11.verse: They will talk together about the glory of your kingdom and mention examples of your power.

12.verse: They will tell about your miracles and about the majesty and glory of your reign.

13.verse: For your kingdom never ends. You rule generation after generation.

14.verse: The Lord lifts the fallen and those bent beneath their loads.

15.verse: The eyes of all mankind look up to you for help; you give them their food as they need it.

16.verse: You constantly satisfy the hunger and thirst of every living thing.

17.verse: The Lord is fair in everything he does and full of kindness.

18.verse: He is close to all who call on him sincerely.

19.verse: He fulfills the desires of those who reverence and trust him; he hears their cries for help and rescues them.

20.verse: He protects all those who love him, but destroys the wicked.

21.verse: I will praise the Lord and call on all men everywhere to bless his holy name forever and forever.

1.verse: Praise the Lord! Yes, really praise him!

2.verse: I will praise him as long as I live, yes, even with my dying breath.

3.verse: Don’t look to men for help; their greatest leaders fail;

4.verse: for every man must die. His breathing stops, life ends, and in a moment all he planned for himself is ended.

5.verse: But happy is the man who has the God of Jacob as his helper, whose hope is in the Lord his God—

6.verse: the God who made both earth and heaven, the seas and everything in them. He is the God who keeps every promise,

7.verse: who gives justice to the poor and oppressed and food to the hungry. He frees the prisoners

8.verse: and opens the eyes of the blind; he lifts the burdens from those bent down beneath their loads. For the Lord loves good men.

9.verse: He protects the immigrants and cares for the orphans and widows. But he turns topsy-turvy the plans of the wicked.

10.verse: The Lord will reign forever. O Jerusalem, your God is King in every generation! Hallelujah! Praise the Lord!

1.verse: Hallelujah! Yes, praise the Lord! How good it is to sing his praises! How delightful, and how right!

2.verse: He is rebuilding Jerusalem and bringing back the exiles.

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted, binding up their wounds.

4.verse: He counts the stars and calls them all by name.

5.verse: How great he is! His power is absolute! His understanding is unlimited.

6.verse: The Lord supports the humble, but brings the wicked into the dust.

7.verse: Sing out your thanks to him; sing praises to our God, accompanied by harps.

8.verse: He covers the heavens with clouds, sends down the showers, and makes the green grass grow in mountain pastures.

9.verse: He feeds the wild animals, and the young ravens cry to him for food.

10.verse: The speed of a horse is nothing to him. How puny in his sight is the strength of a man.

11.verse: But his joy is in those who reverence him, those who expect him to be loving and kind.

12.verse: Praise him, O Jerusalem! Praise your God, O Zion!

13.verse: For he has fortified your gates against all enemies and blessed your children.

14.verse: He sends peace across your nation and fills your barns with plenty of the finest wheat.

15.verse: He sends his orders to the world. How swiftly his word flies.

16.verse: He sends the snow in all its lovely whiteness, scatters the frost upon the ground,

17.verse: and hurls the hail upon the earth. Who can stand before his freezing cold?

18.verse: But then he calls for warmer weather, and the spring winds blow and all the river ice is broken.

19.verse: He has made known his laws and ceremonies of worship to Israel—

20.verse: something he has not done with any other nation; they have not known his commands. Hallelujah! Yes, praise the Lord!

1.verse: Praise the Lord, O heavens! Praise him from the skies!

2.verse: Praise him, all his angels, all the armies of heaven.

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon and all you twinkling stars.

4.verse: Praise him, skies above. Praise him, vapors high above the clouds.

5.verse: Let everything he has made give praise to him. For he issued his command, and they came into being;

6.verse: he established them forever and forever. His orders will never be revoked.

7.verse: And praise him down here on earth, you creatures of the ocean depths.

8.verse: Let fire and hail, snow, rain, wind, and weather all obey.

9.verse: Let the mountains and hills, the fruit trees and cedars,

10.verse: the wild animals and cattle, the snakes and birds,

11.verse: the kings and all the people with their rulers and their judges,

12.verse: young men and maidens, old men and children—

13.verse: all praise the Lord together. For he alone is worthy. His glory is far greater than all of earth and heaven.

14.verse: He has made his people strong, honoring his godly ones—the people of Israel, the people closest to him. Hallelujah! Yes, praise the Lord!

1.verse: Hallelujah! Yes, praise the Lord! Sing him a new song. Sing his praises, all his people.

2.verse: O Israel, rejoice in your Maker. O people of Jerusalem, exult in your King.

3.verse: Praise his name with dancing, accompanied by drums and lyre.

4.verse: For Jehovah enjoys his people; he will save the humble. Let his people rejoice in this honor. Let them sing for joy as they lie upon their beds.

5.verse: For Jehovah enjoys his people; he will save the humble. Let his people rejoice in this honor. Let them sing for joy as they lie upon their beds.

6.verse: Adore him, O his people! And take a double-edged sword to execute his punishment upon the nations.

7.verse: Adore him, O his people! And take a double-edged sword to execute his punishment upon the nations.

8.verse: Bind their kings and leaders with iron chains,

9.verse: and execute their sentences. He is the glory of his people. Hallelujah! Praise him!

1.verse: Hallelujah! Yes, praise the Lord! Praise him in his Temple and in the heavens he made with mighty power.

2.verse: Praise him for his mighty works. Praise his unequaled greatness.

3.verse: Praise him with the trumpet and with lute and harp.

4.verse: Praise him with the drums and dancing. Praise him with stringed instruments and horns.

5.verse: Praise him with the cymbals, yes, loud clanging cymbals.

6.verse: Let everything alive give praises to the Lord! You praise him! Hallelujah!
